title: Integrative and Inclusive Education
banerDescription: Gain qualifications to work in integrative and inclusive education, supporting students with special educational needs.
description:
• Teachers wishing to obtain qualifications in inclusive education
  • Individuals working with children and youth with special educational needs
  • Pedagogues and psychologists wanting to expand their competencies
  • Those interested in working as a supporting teacher
description2: Graduates of bachelor's studies, upon completion of postgraduate studies, obtain qualifications in inclusive education in kindergartens and primary schools. Completion of postgraduate studies by a master's degree graduate allows for teaching in all types of schools, including work as a supporting teacher.
description3: Graduates acquire qualifications to work as inclusive education teachers in kindergartens, schools, and educational, care, and rehabilitation institutions. According to the new reform on standards for employing specialists, a graduate of this field who holds a master's degree in pedagogy is eligible to work as a special educator.

faculty: Classes are conducted by experienced practitioners in the field of integrative and inclusive education, special education, and psychology.
practices:
• Internship I includes 60 hours and is carried out in semester 1.
  • Internship II includes 120 hours and is carried out in semester 3.
  • Internships can be carried out in kindergartens, integrative schools, educational institutions, and institutions supporting inclusive education.
evaluation: The assessment of learning outcomes is based on activity during classes, completion of individual modules, implementation of internships, and preparation of a diploma thesis.
jobOpportunities:
Graduates of the program will be prepared to work as:

  • Supporting teachers in kindergartens and schools
  • Specialists in integrative and inclusive education
  • Special educators in educational institutions
  • Consultants in educational and therapeutic institutions
  • Employees of support centers for students with special educational needs
invite: Gain the qualifications and skills necessary to work in integrative and inclusive education, supporting the development of every student.
